Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the building in which the game is played. The building is represented as a two dimensional array which is stored in board. The grid holds all the positions of all objects within the game, as well as the lighting.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int DIMENSION
      The dimension of the board.

      This is the debug method.

    • Field Detail

      • DIMENSION

        public final int DIMENSION
        The dimension of the board. Useful so that if this needs to change, each individual value will not have to be changed
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        Constructor for the Grid class. This will generate the board by calling generateBoards(). The board will then be accessed by GameEngine.

    • Method Detail

      • look

        public void look​(int x,
                 int y,
                 int direction)
        This method looks in a specified direction to reveal the spaces that are two ahead of the player.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coord of the player
        y - the y coord of the player
        direction - the direction to look

      • debugMode

        public void debugMode​(boolean enable,
                      Briefcase bCase,
                      Player player)
        This is the debug method. It is an option given to the player that will turn on all the lights in the grid and allow the player to to see everything that is happening in the grid. This method was included so that the player can assure that the game is working as expected
        Parameters:
        enable - true if debug mode should be on, false if it should be off
        bCase - the briefcase object
        player - the player object

      • eraseGrid

        public void eraseGrid()
        This method is used to update the grid. It erases everything currently on the grid with the exception of the rooms.

      • enableCaseLighting

        public void enableCaseLighting​(Briefcase briefcase)
        This method is used for the radar, and makes it so that the grid prints out the location of the briefcase.
        Parameters:
        briefcase - the briefcase object

      • roomLighting

        public void roomLighting()
        This method is in charge of the lighting of the rooms where the rooms are located. It allows the player to see where the rooms are and make their way over to them while avoiding enemies

      • getBoard

        public char[][] getBoard()
        Gets the current game board and returns it so the GameEngine can use it.
        Returns:
        the board

      • assign

        public void assign​(int x,
                   int y,
                   char character)
        This method assigns chars to certain locations on the grid
        Parameters:
        x - the row to assign it to
        y - the column to assign it to
        character - the character representation of the object being assigned

      • getLight

        public boolean[][] getLight()
        gets the current state of the grid with regards to lighting
        Returns:
        the board state with regards to lighting
